column3: School of Life and Medical Science
column5: Why Choose Herts?Flexible: This course is designed to fit in with your work, family, and lifestyle commitments.Industry Accreditation: This course is delivered in line with public health practice guidance from the Faculty of Public Health and accredited by the European Agency for Public Health Education Accreditation (APHEA).Employment Prospects: Graduates are currently working as doctors, pharmacists, nurses, and health professionals within the National Health Service improving their practitioner and management careers upon completion of this course.Extended Placement and Advanced Research pathway options available.About the courseThe range of optional modules offered and the breadth of cases used across the programme will provide opportunities for specialism in the global and local context.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: Full Time: 1 year | Part Time: 2 years
